descr: A field with a nominal attribute value. For example, areas with particular land use types.
A field with a boolean attribute value. For example, a boolean field representing being inside or outside of a buffer.
A field with an ordinal attribute value. For example, field drawn as a contour.
A field with an interval attribute value. For example, a field showing an average temperature.
A field with a ratio attribute value. For example, a field representing distance from a certain location or object or density of objects.
A field with a count attribute value.
A nominal quality (attribute) of a network.
A boolean quality (attribute) of a network.
An ordinal quality (attribute) of a network.
An interval quality (attribute) of a network.
An interval quality (attribute) of a network. For example, an amount of traffic flow on a road segment or a network distance between a source and a destination.
A count quality (attribute) of a network. For example, a number of cars on a road segment.
A network comprising of objects, events, or statistical grid units. For example, a path between objects.
A nominal quality/attribute of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, a country name.
A boolean quality of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, a sale status (for sale or not for sale) of houses.
An ordinal quality of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, a priority level of fire accidents.
An interval quality of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, a construction year of a building.
A ratio quality of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, an average population age of a neighbourhood.
A count quality of an object, event, or statistical grid unit. For example, a number of people in a neighbourhood.
A location or area of an object, event, or statistical grid unit.
An object, event, or a statistical grid unit. It may have an attribute with an unknown measurement level.
A nominal value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
A boolean value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
An ordinal value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
An interval value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
A ratio value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
A count value that is either standalone or may belong to some unknown feature (e.g., object, event, field, etc).
